Sentence: The novel's protagonist, Taylor Greer, who is known at the beginning of the novel by her (Bean) given name, Marietta, or by her (Marietta) nickname, Missy, remembers a moment in her (Marietta) childhood when Newt Hardbine's father was thrown to the top of the Chevron sign after his (father) tractor tire exploded
Taylor goes on to tell the story of Newt Hardbine, a peer of Taylor's who died while Taylor was still in high school
Although Newt and Taylor seemed like identical kids when they were small, Taylor was the one to escape small-town life
